title.narrative: Helpdesk MR/Demokratisk Samhällsstyrning och PFM/Biståndseffektivitet Afrika
Helpdesk for Human Rights/Dem. governance inkl. PFM/ Aid Effectiveness Africa

description.narrative: Insatsen är en Helpdesk för mänskliga rättigheter/demokratisk samhällsstyrning inkl offentlig finansiell styrning och biståndseffektivitet. Det etablerades genom avrop från Sidas Ramavtal för demokrati och offentlig förvaltning. Helpdesken skall utgöra en stödfunktion för ambassader i Afrika och Afrikaavdelningen på Sida i Stockholm. Det kan användas för korttidsuppdrag på maximalt 10 dagar, inom ramen för ovan nämnda tematiska områden och i alla faser (planering, genomförande, uppföljning) av Sidas huvudprocesser, samt kapacitets- och kompetensutveckling för ambassader i Afrika och Sida i Stockholm. Tjänsterna inkluderar att skriva rapporter eller andra dokument, göra presentationer, delta i seminarier och diskussioner, delta i kortare missioner/uppdrag, ge muntliga eller skriftliga kommentarer, ge råd, utbildning eller annat stöd. Andra tjänster kan också utgöra en del av kontraktet.

The contribution is a Human Rights/Democratic Governance Helpdesk including Public Financial Management and Aid Effectiveness. It was established through a call-off from Sida's Framework Agreement for Democracy and Public Administration. The Help Desk is a support function for embassies in Africa and the Africa Department at Sida in Stockholm. It may be used for short-term assignments for a maximum of 10 days within the above-mentioned thematic areas, in all phases (planning, implementation, follow-up) of Sida's main processes, as well as in capacity and skills development for embassies in Africa and Sida in Stockholm. Services may include: write reports or other documents, make presentations, participate in seminars and discussions, participate in shorter missions/assignments, give oral or written comments, advice, training and other support. Other services may also form part of the contract.

This assignment was to set up a help-desk whose purpose it was to support the Africa Department's appraisal, decision-making, dialogue and follow-up processes within the specified areas (see below) through short term expert advice, offered on request from both Headquarters and Embassy level. The aim was also to complement and strengthen Sida's own resources and competences, and to provide capacity and competence development when requested. The areas included for this helpdesk were: Local Democracy and Decentralisation, Political Institutions, Political Participation and Pluralism, State-building, State Capacity and Public Administration, Public Financial Management, Aid Effectiveness including Results Based Aid and Results Based Financing, Human Rights Systems, Defenders and Rule of Law, Non-Discrimination, Freedom of Expression and Media, and Human Rights Based Approach. The services were available only to the Africa Department at Sida headquarters and to Swedish embassies in Africa.

description.narrative: The Helpdesk received and completed 14 assignments on a highly varied spectrum of topics and with varying purposes. Six assignments were requested by staff in Swedish embassies in Africa, and 8 by staff at headquarters in Stockholm. The budget would have allowed for more assignments, approximately 40% was utilised. The services provided under this very broad helpdesk were highly varied. A frequent type of assignment continued to be reviewing and strengthening the quality of individual contribution proposals, and a number of assignments sought to map the current situation in a sector in preparation for possible contributions further downstream. Other assignments sought to give Sida and partner staff a better understanding of the latest research and international experience on selected thematic issues . Examples of results: - The Analytical Mapping of Regional and sub-regional CSOs working on Human Rights, Democracy and Governance in Sub-Saharan Africa resulted in identifying relevant actors in the intended area. The result was also deemed to be of good quality and up to standard. - Studies on Experiences of Institutional Development in Fragile Contexts - Case Studies on Burkina Faso, Liberia and Somalia; these two studies resulted in knowledge sharing and learning on methods for institutional development in fragile contexts, but also on adaptive and flexible ways of working with development, such as working with problem-driven iterative approaches.
